Small place, but it's the bomb to get the biscoff spread. If you haven't had this before, you should try it. This is also the cheapest place to buy it. Usually it's available at specialty stores at a high premium for being imported, but this place sells a jar for $6-7. I believe they also give samples of it if you ask. 

They also cater very well to tourists or even if you're a local. I guess they just assume everyone is a tourist so they will wrap your glass jar so it's ready for packing. How nice!
author: Beverly T.

description:
I was here couple weeks ago. The place is small and clean. They have a place to order indoors or a window to do it from outside. The service is quick. I ordered their mint tea which was decent. 

I was surprised to see a biscuit with  my tea when it was ready. 

Overall, I was pleased with visiting this place.
author: Anisha G.

description: Coffee served with a side of Biscoff's famous Belgian spiced cookies.... not to mention a hearty helping of really bad attitude. Why do the people that work here hate their customers? On my last visit, not only were the cashiers not helpful, they were almost hostile to the customers.  They even got my order wrong!  That said, if you can stomach the bad service,  the coffee is good and the cookies are exceptional. All different types of Biscoff's speculoos cookies and cookie spreads are available for purchase, as well.  If you park in the Pier 39 Parking Garage, check your parking stub for a coupon.  It's buy one coffee drink, get a second coffee drink 50% off  (unfortunately they wouldn't let us substitute with juices and smoothies).
author: Emcee K.

description:
The coffee is really good and the service is friendly. They have a Krispy Kreme doughnut case which is always great, but my fave part is the free Biscoff cookie you get with your cuppa joe! They are so good! Like, insanely good. I had to buy a pack of them the next day. They are perfect to dip in your hot coffee. 
Visiting the Biscoff Coffee Corner after dinner and taking a walk around Pier 39 was one of my favorite things about staying at Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Lauren S.

description: Great espresso, courteous service and very convenient location. The custard filled doughnut was OK but their cookies are delicious. We will definitely go back here next time we are in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: Carl J.

description:
A new addiction. I don't need another one. But the coffee and the cookies they have here are wonderful!

I wouldn't have stopped in unless I had a 30% off coupon from one of the restaurants on the pier. I'm so glad I did because this is a new favorite find!
author: Madeline R.

description: Ordered a number of drinks. Reminds me of Starbucks but they give you a little Biscoff cookie with each drink. I had a White Chocolate Moca and compared to Starbucks it was pretty decent.
author: GB B.

description: OMG so the jar of biscoff spread I bought is totally gone. It tasted AH MAZING. I am going back to SF just to stock up on it and it's super low calorie. I LOVE IT.
author: Lucia N.

description: Little coffee shop and tourist shop at Pier 39.  They make your coffee quick, have nice ginormous cookies and baked goods available for a midday snack.  I also really enjoy the Biscoff cookies by Lotus.  We liked it so much that we bought the big box online and had it shipped for Christmas to give a small treat to co-workers in their stockings.  Only thing is there's really nowhere to sit inside...grab your coffee and get to steppin!
author: Dee H.

description: Yummy coffee and great biscotti! Very cute cafe on Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Natasha F.

description:
their biscoff cold blend? to. die. for. 

it's like their coookie, but in a shake! AHH. SOOO GOOD!
author: Ramandeep K.

description: small shop, but has a decent selection of biscoff stuff.  there was a line, so i was worried it would take awhile, but it moved quickly.   my friend is always raving about the little cookies, so i had to get her some when i saw the store.  my one mistake... i tried the cookies.  omg, have you had these things??? so addictive... sooooooo addictive.  it's one of those things you can't stop at just one.  do yourself a favor... buy lots!
author: Linnea E.

description: Great cookie.....not the greatest java though. Not for that price.
author: Danny M.

description:
This place has never failed to offer up the worst possible service in the world. I work across the street, so it's convenient for me to go there. They are a Coffee Place and offer cofffee, it should be a go to for me..right?
Wrong.
I have never ever been there once in the last six years without having the following problem, not once
1.)Always out of coffee, not just one Dispenser but at least two to three out of four. I always alway always have to wait at least 10 minutes for them to make more and refil the servers before I can get some. It's like Lucy pulling the Football away at the last minute as Charlie Brown goes to kick it. 
2.)They are always rude, inept or badly spoken in thier dealings. The Manager himself is hostile and rude and has poor people skills. It's puzzling that someone who seems to hate people and hate serving people should pick this kind of business to go into. 
3.The coffee is always bad or old or cold. They make hands down the worst coffee in san francisco.
I tend to buy my coffee at Starbucks or Peets but I have to walk several blocks to do so, it's worth it to avoid this place.
There will always be a bevy of unaware tourists coming here to buy thier wares, but not me. I'm done, I have had it, they fail and fail and fail again and again and again. 
At least they are consistant, I will give them that!!!
author: Dean J.

description: Biscoff is perfect for a great cup of coffee. For bake goods. The people who work there are amazing!!!! I love the Biscoff Latte and the Mexican Mocha my favorite drinks there.
author: Alexandra A.

description: A great little coffee shop conveniently located on Pier 39.  Staff was friendly, and you receive a complimentary cookie with each coffee you purchase.  Yum!
author: Emily O.

description:
I stop here for coffee whenever I'm in the area.  Different and delish espresso creations.  Friendly staff.  And the free cookie is the perfect lttle snack with an espresso.

Coffee: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Ambiance: 3/5
author: M R.

description: This place had pretty good coffee, and it looked like they were providing their own brand (San Francisco Coffee Company, or something like that) which are also available in packs for purchase. At $1.75 for a small VIP of coffee, I felt the price was quite reasonable given their location being in touristy Pier 39.
author: H K.

description: They improved their pastries , the result.: perfection!! Love the ham and cheese croissant , and the raspberry one, well done!!
author: Karen P.

description: Not a fan of the cookies, but when you crush them put them in a jar with a bunch of other ingredients it becomes Speculoos.  Most people never heard of such thing, is really popular in belgium.  If you are a local ride your bike there grab a jar or two and you will be hooked.
author: Albert G.

description:
yummy lattes and good pastries. 
Went there several times while at the Wharf for the weekend! big fan!
author: Mary T.

description: Absolutely the best cookies in the city! I love them. I buy them as gifts to bring to people I visit. The coffee is also good (I usually get black coffee, so I can't comment on the fancy drinks). And dip the cookie in the coffee...perfection. It is in a touristy area (Pier 39), but if there is a line it moves quickly and usually there isn't a line. I definitely recommend this place.
author: Francie M.

description: I don't think this would be my everyday coffee place but it was definitely fun as a tourist activity.  I especially enjoyed the little cookie I received with my coffee.  I ordered a double tall soy latte, which ended up costing me $4.50... being from Seattle I was less than impressed with the way the latte was made, but enjoyed the experience of this little shop anyway!
author: Hailee G.

description: Mocha was cold. Banana nut muffin was dry.
author: Jessica T.

description: I love Biscoff, have been ordering from their catalog for years.  I did not know they have a store at PIER 39.  I was a little disappointed, there wasn't that many choices that you can choose.  Seem like they only carry a few kind of cookies.  I was hoping they have everything you see in the catalog.
author: Mike C.

description:
This place has a decent coffee like many other coffees shop and we like to have coffee here each time we come down to Pier 39 for sailing. It was nice to have a small tasty biscuit with the coffee. However the service needs to be reviewed by owner. The girl who made coffee on Sunday around 10:15a had an awful attitude. And she was the one who messed up the order! We order a bagel and a medium latte with extra shot. She gave our coffee to someone else and when I finally asked where mine was she handed me someone elses latte. I asked if it had 3 shots and she snapped back that an extra shot was 75 cents. I said I had already paid for it and she said I had to show her the receipt which I did. Even then she insisted that my receipt was for earlier in the day (which it was by about 5 minutes due to me waiting). She acted as though I was trying to cheat her by getting a free coffee!  I don't even think she could actually read the receipt correctly to be honest.  In the end she gave me somone else's latte and gave me attitude when she pushed it across the counter. I told her  she was very rude and that when you make a mistake you shouldn't treat the customer as though they did something wrong to which she told me to go complain to the manager.  If I hadn't been holding up my Navy buddy during fleet week over a cup of coffee I probably would have.  She should not be working at this store where so many tourist come by for coffee. She gave everyone a very bad impression.
By way of contrast, on Saturday the guy making the coffee was very friendly and gave us an extra package of their biscuits when we mentioned how tastey they were.
author: Kim H.

description: Plain old, good coffee and a wonderful cookie.
author: Mike O.

description: I found this over the weekend while showing a friend the city and loved it! Great coffee, super yummy FREE cookie and the best apple cider ever. The cider is so popular that they were sold out when I came back  after dinner. Can't wait to get it next time I'm at Pier 39!
author: Nina Z.
